meanings.definition: In a manner deserving contempt or scorn.
meanings.sent1: He behaved despicably towards his classmates by spreading rumors.
meanings.sent2: The villain despicably stole from the poor and needy.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at me despicably when I forgot to feed it on time.
meanings.sent4: The weeds in the garden grew despicably fast, choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The bully's actions were so despicably cruel that they left a lasting impact on the victim.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is vile or detestable.
meanings.sent1: The dictator ruled despicably, oppressing his people at every turn.
meanings.sent2: The criminal acted despicably, showing no remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent3: The toddler looked at the broccoli despicably, refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged despicably, tearing through the town with no mercy.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the garbage can was so despicably foul that it made everyone gag.
